channel.title: elizaOS Council Briefings
channel.description: Strategic briefings, retrospectives, and deliberation items for elizaOS leadership

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-29
item.description:
Daily Focus: The transition toward ElizaOS v2.0 is accelerating via a strategic technical pivot toward n8n-driven workflow automation and multi-language reliability (Rust/Python), despite lingering migration friction and platform scaling risks.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Strategy Pivot: Workflow-Centric Architecture: The core development team is shifting focus from building fragmented native plugins to a centralized, n8n-integrated workflow engine for v2.0....
  • Trust & Brand Identity Stabilization: Persistent migration technical issues and a 'dry' corporate online presence are threatening community confidence during the token transition....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-28
item.description:
Daily Focus: The core team has rapidly pivoted toward an AI workflow automation platform leveraging n8n, prioritizing immediate user utility over low-level infrastructure.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Strategic Pivot: Dynamic AI Workflows: Development is shifting from hardware focus to a high-level AI assistant layer integrating n8n for natural language workflow creation. This aims to satisfy the 95% of users demanding service connectiv...
  • Ecosystem Health and Contributor Concentration: The transition to v2.0.0 is heavily dependent on a few core contributors, creating a potential 'bus factor' risk as complexity increases with Python and Rust ports....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-27
item.description:
Daily Focus: Navigating a critical juncture of fiscal runway constraints, community sentiment volatility regarding tokenomics, and the re-stabilization of core technical leadership.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Ecosystem Funding and Tokenomics Strategy: The project faces a strategic tension between preserving elizaOS token value and the necessity of launching sub-sector tokens (like Hyperscape's Gold) to fund development during a period of limited tr...
  • Technical Infrastructure & Reliability: Recent logs indicate critical bug fixes in the CLI and core framework, alongside significant progress on MCP integration and the return of key technical personnel....
  • Strategic Partnership & Platform Expansion: New opportunities to deploy Eliza as a flagship assistant on emerging hardware platforms present a high-visibility, low-cost marketing opportunity....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-26
item.description:
Daily Focus: Strategic tension rises between rapid ecosystem expansion via sub-tokens and the imperative for core framework stability and $elizaos token alignment.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Ecosystem Sub-Token Strategy: The launch of separate tokens (GOLD, BAGS, CJFT) to fund specific projects has sparked community friction regarding value accrual and dilution of the $elizaos core token....
  • V2 Architectural Scaling & Contributor Risk: Development on V2.0.0 is accelerating with Rust, Python, and WASM implementations, but creates a high review dependency on a small cohort of core developers....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-25
item.description:
Daily Focus: The Council must address critical friction between core team funding strategies and community trust amidst the Hyperscape 'GOLD' token controversy and resource constraints.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Ecosystem Funding & Token Utility Strategy: The launch of project-specific tokens like GOLD has sparked intense community backlash despite a documented 8-month financial runway and $20M market cap. This creates a strategic tension between the n...
  • v2.0.0 Architectural Resilience & Contributor Dynamics: Operational logs indicate massive code churn toward v2.0.0 and WASM compatibility, but identify critical bottlenecks in ownership concentration. Specifically, a few core contributors are handling the ...

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-24
item.description:
Daily Focus: The council must reconcile the friction between rapid, experimental token launches and the core objective of building a reliable, developer-first enterprise framework.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Ecosystem Reputation & Launch Integrity: Recent controversies surrounding the GOLD token and internal project monetization have triggered community distrust and questions regarding the 'Execution Excellence' principle....
  • Infrastructure Scalability (Jeju & Cloud): The transition to V2.0.0 and the proposed Jeju distributed compute network require a strategic decision on hardware and verification protocols....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-23
item.description:
Daily Focus: Transitioning from technical instability in v1.7.2 toward a robust v2.0.0 architecture while enforcing strict ecosystem standards for token utility and developer conduct.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Ecosystem Integrity & Token Meta: The Council must address a crisis in developer tokenomics where improper launches are damaging community trust and project liquidity. A new 'fee-based revenue' standard is being enforced to replace th...
  • v2.0.0 Architectural Pivot & Reliability: Recent stability issues in v1.7.2 drive the strategic necessity for the v2.0.0 dynamic execution engine and improved cross-chain scaling via Jeju....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-22
item.description:
Daily Focus: The technical pivot toward stabilizing API pipelines and core database architecture is at odds with community anxiety regarding token utility and migration clarity.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • V2.0 Architectural Reliability: Critical work on the Dynamic Execution Engine and WASM runtime is progressing, but deployment stability depends on resolving persistent database migration issues between PGLite and PostgreSQL....
  • Token Utility and Migration Trust: Persistent community confusion over airdrops and the transition between ai16z and elizaOS tokens requires a shift from technical updates to narrative-driven economics....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-21
item.description:
Daily Focus: The project faces a critical perception gap where technical progression toward ElizaOS Cloud and Jeju remains robust, yet token utility and roadmap communication are causing significant community friction and market volatility.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Token Utility & Communication Architecture: Community frustration is peaking due to the 70% decline in token value and perceived lack of utility outside of the future Jeju network. While the team focuses on 'building in silence,' partners deman...
  • Technical Performance and V2 Transition: Significant strides have been made in runtime optimization (40% faster warm starts) and the development of the V2 Rust/WASM core, but documentation gaps for the current CLI and plugin compatibility pe...

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-20
item.description:
Daily Focus: The framework solidifies its technical foundation via version 1.7.2 while simultaneously expanding its frontier through a functional WASM runtime and specialized high-performance rust infrastructure.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Platform Stability vs. Rapid Expansion: While v1.7.2 addresses critical race conditions and rebuild loops, the push for WASM and Rust-based high-performance trading systems indicates a split in architectural focus between ecosystem accessib...
  • Economic Autonomy & Token Utility: Community interest in automated token rewards and high-performance trading plugins highlights the need for a clear, secure economic layer within the framework....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-19
item.description:
Daily Focus: The framework faces a critical divergence between internal resource constraints/token volatility and breakthrough technical advancements in multi-platform (WASM/Rust) agent portability.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Strategic Resource & Token Alignment: Community sentiment has dipped due to perceived budget constraints and token utility stagnation, contrasting with aggressive core shipping. A high-profile staffing trade-off for API costs highlights c...
  • V2 Architecture and Multi-Platform Portability: Technical logs indicate a major shift toward Rust-based core logic and WebAssembly (WASM) to enable agents to run in browser/Node environments, increasing framework ubiquity....
  • AI-Optimized Documentation & Agent UX: The 'Taming Information' strategy is entering a meta-phase where AI is being used to rewrite documentation specifically for consumption by other AI agents....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-18
item.description:
Daily Focus: The framework is shifting toward a high-performance Rust core (v2.0.0) while grappling with immediate security spoofing threats and the complexities of multi-chain infrastructure on ICP and Polymarket.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • V2 Architectural Transition & Performance: Development suggests TypeScript is hitting performance ceilings for real-time high-load agents, necessitating the pivot to Rust (v2.0.0) and NATS Jetstream for scalability....
  • Security and Verification Gaps: Recent GitHub spoofing incidents and confusion over bot wallet requirements (Sparta) highlight a need for robust authentication protocols and clear team communication....
  • Multi-Chain & Oracle Strategy: Expansion to ICP and complexity in Polymarket Safe multisigs indicate elizaOS is becoming a cross-chain orchestration layer rather than just an LLM wrapper....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-17
item.description:
Daily Focus: Transitioning the framework toward v2.0 high-performance primitives while managing high-stakes security incidents and community trust during token migration.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Framework Architecture Pivot (v2.0): Shaw and the core team are aggressively stripping the monolith to focus on high-performance Rust/TS runtime and WASM compatibility. This represents a move toward the 'Developer First' principle but ri...
  • Security Hygiene & Authenticity: High-fidelity spoofing incidents on GitHub and Twitter are challenging the 'Trust Through Shipping' mandate. Our current verification protocols (PGP/MFA) must be visible to builders to prevent ecosyst...
  • Economic Alignment & Token Migration: The migration deadline (Feb 4) and significant whale selling pressure are creating market sentiment anxiety. Builders are questioning token utility beyond speculation....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-16
item.description:
Daily Focus: Transitioning from critical v2.0 development to a hyper-focus on ElizaOS Cloud stability while managing the high-friction final phases of the token migration mission.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Strategic Priority Realignment: The core leadership has mandated a total deprioritization of v2.0.0 branch development in favor of aggressive cloud infrastructure hardening and monorepo stability....
  • Token Utility & Market Positioning: External sentiment is currently decoupled from development progress, with concerns over long-term token utility and visibility outside the top 200 market ranking....
  • Compute Network Latency Constraints: Analyses of the Jeju Network suggest that real-time inference is currently non-viable on decentralized networks, requiring a shift in use-case targeting....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-15
item.description:
Daily Focus: The council faces a critical synchronization of architectural breakthroughs in Eliza 2.0 with a pivot toward Cloud stability to restore token utility and index-level market capitalization.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

  • Strategic Resource Redirection: The core team has officially deprioritized v2.0.0 branch work to focus exclusively on ElizaOS Cloud reliability and feature parity. This move addresses immediate community concerns regarding token uti...
  • Eliza 2.0 Architectural Paradigm: Shaw has successfully integrated the planning plugin and extended memory into Eliza core, dramatically reducing boilerplate. However, this has triggered concerns regarding database optimization and LL...

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-14
item.description:
Daily Focus: The core development team has made a critical strategic pivot to deprioritize v2.0.0 development entirely in favor of stabilizing ElizaOS Cloud and monorepo reliability.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Strategic Resource Realignment: Core developers have shifted focus away from the Rust-based v2.0.0 rewrite to address immediate reliability and credit idempotency issues in ElizaOS Cloud....
  • Ecosystem Identity & Governance: The emergence of community agents like ElizaBAO achieving affiliate status highlights a lack of formal distinction between official and third-party sector entities....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-13
item.description:
Daily Focus: The transition toward the Jeju Network represents the critical pivot from speculative token value to utility-driven gas fee sustainability for the decentralized agent economy.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Jeju Network & Token Utility: The Council must address the long-term roadmap for the Jeju Layer, which aims to convert the elizaOS token into a functional gas fee unit for autonomous agents....
  • ElizaCloud App Creator Stability: Developer feedback on the ElizaCloud 'App Creator' feature reveals significant friction in the non-technical user onboarding experience....
  • V2.0.0 Architectural Consolidation: Development activity indicates a massive structural shift toward the V2 release, focusing on Rust-based performance and core modularization....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-12
item.description:
Daily Focus: The council must reconcile major infrastructural expansion plans (Jeju Layer) with critical user-facing friction in the current token migration and cloud deployment interfaces.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Infrastructural Sovereignty vs. User Trust: While leadership projects mid-2026 for the Jeju utility layer, current users are reporting critical failures in the token migration UI and basic cloud deployment....
  • Architectural Evolution: Eliza 2.0 and Local-First AI: Proposals for a radical Eliza 2.0 runtime overhaul and local-first Claude Code alternatives suggest a shift toward hardware-agnostic sovereignty....

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-11
item.description:
Daily Focus: The transition toward Eliza 2.0 and the Jeju Layer 2 launch has introduced a critical tension between rapid technical innovation (Rust/multi-language support) and deteriorating community trust regarding token utility and transparency.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Token Utility vs. Regulatory Optics: The delisting of elizaOS/ai16z tokens from Korean exchanges due to lack of transparency in migration creates a significant barrier to the goal of 'Trust Through Shipping' and highlights the urgent nee...
  • Eliza 2.0 Architectural Pivot: The proposal for Eliza 2.0 to move toward a Rust/multi-language runtime with FFI plugin interoperability represents a massive technical leap but threatens to fragment the current developer base if not...

item.title: Council Briefing: 2026-01-10
item.description:
Daily Focus: The focus shifted toward long-term survivability: architecting the 'Eliza 2.0' radical redesign while managing a critical regulatory delisting crisis on Korean exchanges.

Monthly Goal: December 2025: Execution excellence—complete token migration with high success rate, launch ElizaOS Cloud, stabilize flagship agents, and build developer trust through reliability and clear documentation.

Key Topics:

  • Architecture Evolution: Eliza 2.0 Redesign: Shaw has proposed and already begun porting a radical overhaul that replaces traditional APIs and servers with a multi-language, Claude-friendly runtime. This aims to maximize framework reliability an...
  • Token Utility and Regional Regulatory Pressure: The coordinated delisting from Korean exchanges (Bithumb, Korbit, Coinone) due to 'transparency concerns' highlights a critical need for clearly defined token utility and public communication strategi...

item.title: Annual Summary: Year 2025
item.description:
Executive Summary: Across 2025, ElizaOS substantially expanded capability and modernized its foundations: the plugin ecosystem and AI provider surface grew rapidly, social/real-time clients widened the public-facing footprint, and core architecture moved toward modular, agent-scoped, multi-tenant readiness. The product also matured with a redesigned management UI, better observability, and multiple refactors (eventing, messaging, server separation) that collectively set a stronger baseline for cloud deployment and...

Key Achievements:

  • Capability expansion (plugins, chains/DeFi, providers, models, voice): ...
  • Core architecture modernization (modularity, eventing, runtime, messaging, server separation): ...
  • Product surface improvements (UI, observability, management workflows): ...
  • Knowledge/memory and multi-agent foundations: ...
  • Social and real-time presence expansion: ...

item.title: Quarterly Summary: Q4 2025
item.description:
Executive Summary: Q4 2025 was a “foundation-first” quarter: ElizaOS made significant progress on core architecture, reliability, security, and monorepo health—laying groundwork for scale (Cloud, marketplace, multi-tenant deployments) and for higher-quality real-time agent UX via streaming. The engineering trajectory strengthened (server refactor, unified messaging APIs, entity-level security, TypeScript/build stabilization), and the plugin ecosystem continued to mature with practical integrations. In parallel, t...

Key Achievements:

  • Core architecture & reliability (scale readiness): ...
  • Security posture improvements (with remaining gaps): ...
  • Developer experience & delivery health: ...
  • Ecosystem & monetization foundations: ...
  • Real-time agent UX (streaming) initiated: ...

item.title: Monthly Retro: December 2025
item.description:
Premise: The JedAI Council reviews December 2025: a month of deep core hardening (refactors, type safety, dependency upgrades, security fixes), early groundwork for real-time streaming across model providers, and a parallel wave of UX planning—while community trust was stressed by token migration friction, support gaps, and multi-user architecture uncertainty.

December delivered meaningful foundational progress: the core server was refactored for reliability and cleanliness, monorepo build health improved, and at least one critical security issue (secret handling/auth) was addressed. The plugin ecosystem expanded (DeFi, OpenChat, Farcaster local hub), and...

Key Developments:

  • Core server reliability & architecture: Major server refactor and optimization in elizaos/eliza improved structure, reliability patterns, and performance; additional work opened to address c...
  • Monorepo health & type safety: Resolved TypeScript build errors across the monorepo and updated dependencies, reducing breakage and improving maintainability....
  • Security hardening: Fixed critical vulnerabilities related to character secret encryption and server authentication exposure (ELIZA_SERVER_AUTH_TOKEN), though the ecosyst...
  • Streaming groundwork (real-time agents): Initiated streaming support across OpenAI, Anthropic, and OpenRouter plugins—setting up real-time conversational experiences as a platform primitive....
  • Plugin ecosystem expansion: Registry added new community plugins (Moralis DeFi, OpenChat, self-hosted Farcaster hub), extending Web3 and comms capabilities and reducing third-par...

item.title: Monthly Retro: November 2025
item.description:
Premise: The JedAI Council convenes for their November retrospective to assess the critical month of token migration, technical advances, and community challenges. As the AI16Z to ElizaOS migration unfolds and key infrastructure pieces fall into place, the council must chart the path forward for December.

November proved to be a pivotal transition month with the AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration taking center stage alongside significant technical developments. While infrastructure improvements like entity-level security and agent persistence fixes showed strong progress toward v2, community concerns a...

Key Developments:

  • Token Migration: AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration launched with 1:6 ratio but faced user experience challenges including portal issues, CEX support gaps, and documenta...
  • Core Infrastructure: Critical bug fixes for agent settings persistence and new entity-level security implementation significantly improved system reliability...
  • Platform Expansion: New development streams including x402 payment middleware, voice infrastructure, and cross-platform integrations show progress toward v2...
  • Agent Products: Otaku agent entered beta with reported issues around price data accuracy and LP staking functionality...
  • Community Relations: Ongoing X lawsuit demands and migration confusion created community friction despite technical progress...

item.title: Monthly Retro: October 2025
item.description:
Premise: The JedAI Council convenes for their monthly retrospective as October 2025 closes out with significant architectural milestones but persistent community friction around the token migration. The framework is maturing rapidly while the ecosystem faces growing pains.

October marked a pivotal month where ElizaOS achieved major technical milestones in framework modularity and developer experience while simultaneously grappling with token migration uncertainties and community communication challenges. The council debates whether to prioritize technical excellence o...

Key Developments:

  • Core Architecture: Major plugin/config module overhaul with UUID-based agent identification and unified messaging APIs...
  • Developer Experience: CLI refactoring and critical import bug fixes, but persistent onboarding friction for new developers...
  • Token Migration: AI16Z to ElizaOS migration delayed with community confusion and limited exchange support clarity...
  • Strategic Partnerships: IoTeX Real-World AI Foundry partnership and Claude Agent SDK integration expanding ecosystem reach...
  • Community Management: Security concerns with fake accounts and moderation challenges during migration period...

item.title: Quarterly Summary: Q3 2025
item.description:
Executive Summary: Q3 2025 marked a critical maturation phase for ElizaOS, characterized by significant architectural achievements alongside emerging stability challenges. The quarter began with major developer experience improvements and UI redesigns, establishing a strong foundation for v2. However, external dependencies proved fragile with the X/Twitter account suspension, while internal technical debt accumulated, culminating in a CLI crisis that threatened core user workflows. The period revealed a fundamenta...

Key Achievements:

  • Developer Experience Revolution: ...
  • UI/UX Modernization: ...
  • Core Architecture Evolution: ...
  • Cloud Infrastructure Breakthrough: ...

item.title: Monthly Retro: September 2025
item.description:
Premise: The JedAI Council convenes for their monthly retrospective to assess September's developments, focusing on the major CLI architecture crisis, growing technical debt concerns, and community confidence challenges that emerged despite steady technical progress.

September revealed a critical tension between ambitious feature development and architectural stability. While the team made significant progress on core functionality and developer tooling, the CLI crisis and mounting technical debt exposed the need for a more disciplined approach to infrastructure...

Key Developments:

  • CLI Architecture Crisis: Major CLI instability requiring emergency reversion and architectural redesign discussions...
  • Technical Debt Accumulation: TypeScript compilation errors, build warnings, and platform compatibility issues mounting...
  • Community Confidence Erosion: Token concerns, documentation gaps, and communication issues affecting user trust...
  • Core Feature Progress: Dynamic prompting, image generation fixes, and enhanced testing capabilities delivered...
  • Developer Experience Improvements: Unified NPM workflows, Docker support, and build system standardization...

item.title: Quarterly Summary: Q2 2025
item.description:
Executive Summary: Q2 2025 marked a pivotal quarter for ElizaOS, culminating in the successful launch of v2.0 with major architectural improvements including server separation, agent-scoped plugins, and unified testing frameworks. The development velocity remained strong with consistent high-impact releases across CLI modernization, AI provider ecosystem expansion, and enhanced developer tooling. However, this technical progress was overshadowed by persistent reliability issues, particularly with Twitter integrati...

Key Achievements:

  • Platform Maturation: ...
  • AI Provider Ecosystem: ...
  • Developer Experience: ...
  • Community Engagement: ...

item.title: Quarterly Summary: Q1 2025
item.description:
Executive Summary: Q1 2025 was defined by outsized capability expansion and major architectural shifts, alongside growing pressure on reliability, onboarding, and trust surfaces. ElizaOS meaningfully widened its ecosystem reach (chains/DeFi/data providers), increased AI-provider portability, and expanded real-time/social agent presence (Twitter Spaces, Instagram, XMTP), while simultaneously investing in foundational changes (dynamic plugin loading, DB multi-tenancy primitives, and a redesigned agent management UI)...

Key Achievements:

  • Ecosystem & capability expansion (Web3, data, infra): ...
  • Model/provider portability (reduced lock-in): ...
  • Real-time + social presence expansion: ...
  • Platform architecture modernization (modularity + runtime): ...
  • Multi-agent foundation & data model hardening: ...
